Key Match Events: Frank Magri levelled after Mohamed Bayo's early opener for Guinea
Francois Kamano's red card in first half added 45 minutes of extra time
Magri's header equalised for Cameroon early in the second half
Guinea managed to hold out for a draw with 10 men
Pre-Game Insights: Cameroon joined the list of Africa Cup of Nations heavyweights who failed to win their opening game of the tournament
Cameroon were without key striker Vincent Aboubakar due to injury
Rigobert Song's men struggled to break down Guinea's defense
Guinea captain Francois Kamano received a red card before half-time
Cameroon had a man advantage for more than 45 minutes
Senegal won their opening game 3-0 against Gambia
Post-Match Reflections: Cameroon did level early in the second period through Frank Magri's header, but they didn't do anything like enough to win the game
The two sides settled for a draw which puts them level in second place in Group C, behind Senegal
That rather summed up their day; they didn't hit their straps at all this afternoon
Cameroon's performance was disappointing, especially given their numerical advantage
Cameroon have offered precious little in the final third thus far
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guinea defender Mouctar Diakhaby might have done better with a header after meeting Ilaix Moriba's whipped free-kick, but nodded over
Cameroon's goalkeeper Fabrice Ondoa is the cousin of Andre Onana
Cameroon's line-up included Andre-Frank Zambo Anguissa in midfield
Guinea's line-up included Ilaix Moriba, Konate, and Guilavogui in midfield
